note: Values are indexed to 100 in 2015 to compare differences over time.
title: Projected change in dependency ratio depending on labor force participation
subtitle:
– Age dependency is the ratio between the assumed dependents in a population (under-15s and over-65s) and working age population.
– Labor force dependency does not assume age brackets, but instead represents the ratio between those not participating in the workforce to those that are.
– High labor force participation assumes a higher share of people participate in the workforce (e.g. beyond the age of 65).

display.name: Labor force dependency ratio – higher participation

sourceDesc: European Commission and the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)
